title: Chief adviser phones Hadiâ€™s brother, assures him of best possible care
body: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus spoke over the phone tonight with Omar Bin Hadi, brother of Sharif Osman Hadi, who was shot earlier on Friday. During the call made around 9:00pm, the chief adviser said the Advisory Council was deeply concerned and pained over the incident, the CA press wing said in a statement. Assuring maximum cooperation from the government, he told Omar, "I have held an urgent meeting with several advisers and senior officials of the police and security agencies. Directives have been issued to arrest those involved in the attack at the quickest possible time." The chief adviser added that the government would bear all expenses related to Hadi's treatment. Depending on his condition, arrangements would be made for the best possible care, either at home or abroad. "Hadi is very dear to all of us," he said. "We pray for his swift recovery and hope he will return to us soon."
